result.execSummary:
The defendant Natalie T Tripp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay restitution of $750, payable to Jeffrey D. Spotts 
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee

--To pay costs of $268 
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge 

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

--No contact with Jeffrey D. Spotts or his family 
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances or paraphernalia without a valid prescription & approval

--Random urinalyses-at least 1x/mth for the 1st year and then per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety to include alcohol
--To take all medications as prescribed
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent

timeConds.notes: --To serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail (14CF187), with work-release & transfer privileges, to commence in whatever increments to be worked out with Agent but to be served in 2015

supervisions.notes:
On cases 13CF483 & 14CF187:
On each count, The Court sentences Ms. Tripp to 5 1/2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 1/2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is to commence concurrent to each other and to the sentence in 14CF243.

The Court gives 217 days credit for time already served to be applied to each count.

**Per 11/29/17 Order JOC to be amended to reflect an additional 29 days credit**

***Per 6/30/21 Order JOC to be amended to reflect 250 days credit***

superMiscConds.notes: --court orders outstanding costs to be paid
--obtain/maintain employment, defendant is only allowed to quit a job if she gets a better job.

--DNA sample to be provided

Arresting Agency: Johnson Creek PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry

(SF) Cases 13CF483 & 14CF187 called at 1:02 pm  (Court Reporter Kim Keel)
Defendant Natalie T Tripp in court, in custody with Attorney Paul E Bucher. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Bucher advises that there was a third case, but that was an imposed and stayed sentence. Attorney Bucher advises that the defendant self revoked on the companion.
Counsel advises that there are no corrections to the revocation information from the Department of Corrections.

ADA Shock informs the Court that there is victim rights compliance, advises that there was a victim impact statement that was submitted at the original sentencing hearing.
Court finds that there is vicitm rights compliance, Court reviews the previously filed victim impact statement submitted in 14CF187.

ADA Shock presents sentencing recommendation.
Attorney Bucher presents sentencing argument.
Defendant makes statement.

On cases 13CF483 & 14CF187:
On each count, The Court sentences Ms. Tripp to 5 1/2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 1/2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is to commence concurrent to each other and to the sentence in 14CF243.

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 217 days credit for time already served to be applied to each count.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--repay all restitution
--obtain/maintain employment, defendant is only allowed to quit a job if she gets a better job.
--DNA sample to be provided
--court orders outstanding costs to be paid

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 2:00 pm
Defense Sentencing Packet
Order to Produce defendant - SAR - 11-08-17
JA's review of RUMS
Routed to JA for further review. (MG 10-16-17)
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 14, 2017 at 10:00 am.; copy mailed to Defendant c/o Taycheedah Correctional Institution & to Agent Maestre-Rawlings on 10/17/17 (kv)
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 8, 2017 at 01:00 pm.; copy mailed to Defendant c/o Taycheedah Correctional Institution & to Agent Maestre-Rawlings on 10/17/17 (kv)
No updated address information- (MG 9-21-17)
Telephone scheduling conference on October 5, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on October 5, 2017 at 08:15 am.
No updated address information - (MG 9-8-17)

records.addlTxt:
Case 14CF187 called at 11:03 am [Clerk SH] (Court reporter Geri Schrab)
Defendant Natalie T Tripp in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Service of the complaint admitted; reading waived; probable cause found by the Court
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. Tripp waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Court now also calls 14CF243: 11:05 am-Appearances the same
Service of the complaint admitted; reading waived; probable cause found by the Court
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. Tripp waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Court now also calls 13CF483: 11:06 am-Appearances the same
ADA Teuber submits victim impact statements; Atty Dahnert submits letcs. in support of Def. 

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Cts #2 & #3-13CF483, Charge in 14CF187 & Cts #1, #2 & #3-14CF243; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses remaining Counts in 13CF483, 14CF243

On Cts #2 & #3-13CF483 & Charge in 14CF187, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 4 year, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
On Cts#1, #2 & #3-14CF243, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 3.5 YEARS PRISON WITH 18 MONTHS INITIAL CONFINEMENT & 2 YEARS EXTENDED SUPERVISION, each count, concurrent & consecutive to any other sentence in being and places the Defendant on Probation for 4 years, each count, concurrent:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Random urinalyses-at least 1x/mth for the 1st year and then per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety to include alcohol
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances or paraphernalia without a valid prescription & approval
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--To take all medications as prescribed
--No contact with Angela Eikhorn or her family (13CF483)
--To pay costs of $536 ($268 each count-13CF483)
--To pay $500 DNA Surcharge ($250 each count-13CF483)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (13CF483)
--To serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail (14CF187), with work-release & transfer privileges, to commence in whatever increments to be worked out with Agent but to be served in 2015
--No contact with Jeffrey D. Spotts or his family (14CF187)
--To pay costs of $268 (14CF187)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge (14CF187)
--To pay restitution of $750, payable to Jeffrey D. Spotts (14CF187)
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee (14CF187)
--No contact with Leslie Schmidt or her family (14CF243)
--To pay costs of $804 ($268 each count-14CF243)
--To pay restitution of $507.61 payable to Leslie Schmidt (14CF243)
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee (14CF243)
--To pay $750 DNA Surcharge ($250 each count-14CF243)

14CF243: If revoked, the Court finds that Def. is eligible for CIP & SAP

Days credit for time already served: 0 days - as to each case
